result.execSummary:
The defendant Christopher Steven Meritt was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Christopher Steven Meritt is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Christopher Steven Meritt was found guilty of Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Surcharge, Domestic Abuse Incident, Penalties for Misdemeanors-Class "B"], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Concurrent with: current probation being served

miscConds.notes: Costs, surcharges & supervision fees to be paid during the term of probation as arranged by the agent.
Defendant shall undergo treatment and counseling as agent deems appropriate.
